contentrichtext.text: {{Otherplaces}} '''Demetrias''' ({{lang-grc|Δημητριάς}}) was an ancient [[Ancient Greece|Greek]] city in [[Magnesia (regional unit)|Magnesia]] (east central [[Greece]]), near the modern city of [[Volos]]. It was founded by [[Demetrius Poliorcetes]], one of the successors ([[Diadochi]]) of [[Alexander the Great]].{{Clarify|date=January 2010}} ==External links== *[http://www.culture.gr/2/21/211/21113a/e211ma04.html History of Demetrias]{{Dead link|date=January 2010}} {{coord missing|Greece}} [[Category:294 BC establishments]] [[Category:Populated places established in the 3rd century BC]] [[Category:Ancient Greek cities]] [[Category:Ancient Magnesia]] [[Category:Former populated places in Greece]] [[Category:Antigonid colonies]] [[Category:Macedonian colonies in Thessaly]] [[Category:Volos]] {{Thessaly-geo-stub}}
